alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 12:43PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache County through 230 PM MDT/130 PM MST/... At 142 PM MDT/1242 PM MST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Petrified Forest National Park, or 45 miles west of Zuni Pueblo, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds of up to 45 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Witch Well, Petrified Forest National Park, Chambers and Petrified Forest N.P. Headquarters. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 308 and 338. Highway 191 between mile markers 374 and 377. Highway 191 161 between mile markers 340 and 348, and between mile markers 355 and 366. State Route 61 between mile markers 417 and 418. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding and impassable roads due to mud on rural roads. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
